person.headline: NLP / GenAI Researcher & Applied AI Engineer

profile: Data Scientist and AI Engineer specialized in NLP and GenAI. I bridge applied research (NAACL'25, SEPLN'23) with industry delivery, leading Fortune 500 projects and owning end-to-end data/AI pipelines (ingestion, preprocessing, model tuning, deployment). Proficient in GenAI technologies, classic ML and MLOps.

projects.title: StopSlop
projects.one_liner: Chrome extension for low-quality site detection; real-time classification.
highlights: Automated web scraping feeding a real-time classifier.
Custom hyper-efficient FastText-like implementation in NumPy for low-latency inference.

projects.title: mini_snowflake
highlights: Systems-oriented build emphasizing clean data flows and queryable structure.

projects.title: Agentic Insight Generation over Relational Data (NAACL'25)
projects.one_liner: LLM+agent approach to generate analysis insights from relational databases; productionized.
highlights: Deployed to production; reduced operational costs by 99.6% on a production pipeline.

bullets: Delivered GenAI features for Fortune 500 clients: large-scale LLM document extraction for legal contracts and entity matching across data sources.
Designed procurement document-processing pipelines, replacing RAG approaches with a MapReduce design that improved reliability and scalability.

Led development of a Competitive Intelligence app (P&L forecasting, market insights, asset-buy recommendations); database and pipelines design and orchestration, reducing runtime from 60 minutes to under 1 minute.
Mentored an intern, coordinated sprints and code reviews, and regularly presented progress to C-level stakeholders.
Main author of NAACL 2025 paper on using agent-based systems to generate insights from relational databases; deployed to production and reduced operational costs by 99.6% on a production pipeline.
Co-authored synthetic data generation from KG data (WidAug), boosting F1 by 20% for low-resource NER.
Developed a combined NER + machine translation system for low-latency applications, reducing costs by 40%.

education.degree: BSc in Mathematics and Computer Science

publications.title: An LLM-Based Approach for Insight Generation in Data Analysis
Data augmentation for named entity recognition using Wikidata (WidAug)
